techmeme.title: Sources: Supabase, which bills itself as an open-source alternative to Google's Firebase, is raising $100M+ in a round led by Accel, valuing the company at ~$2B (Bloomberg)
Indian police arrest Aleksej Besciokov, the co-founder of Garantex, a Russian crypto exchange sanctioned by the EU and the US, at the request of US authorities (TechCrunch)
French publishers and authors sue Meta for allegedly training AI models on their books without consent, say they have evidence of "massive" copyright breaches (Benoit Berthelot/Bloomberg)
Adobe reports Q1 revenue up 10% YoY to $5.71B, vs. $5.66B est., Digital Media revenue up 11% to $4.23B, and issues a disappointing outlook for Q2 revenue growth (Brody Ford/Bloomberg)
Intel appoints former board member Lip-Bu Tan as CEO, effective March 18; INTC jumps 11%+ after hours (Bhanvi Satija/Reuters)
